subtitle: Souffles are not too difficult to make as long as the oven is preheated before starting.

method.text: Place milk and flavouring ingredients in a medium pan. Bring slowly to boil, remove from heat. Cover and leave to infuse for 30 min.
Strain and reserve milk. Grease a 1 <sup>1</sup>/<sub>4</sub> litre dish.
Preheat oven to 180°C. Place a baking sheet in the oven to heat.

Melt butter in medium saucepan, stir in flour, mustard and seasoning and cook gently for 1 min. Gradually stir in milk, and bring to boil slowly. Continue to cook, stirring until sauce thickens. Cool slightly.
Beat egg yolks into sauce one at a time. Stir in cheese.
Whisk egg whites until stiff. Mix one large spoonful of egg white into sauce, to loosen the mixture, then gently fold in remainder.
Pour mixture into a prepared souffle dish and sprinkle on breadcrumbs. Place on hot baking sheet and bake for 40 min until well risen, golden brown and firm to touch.
Serve at once on hot serving plates.

title: Plain cheese souffle
